alert.note: Alert for City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Fauquier; Loudoun; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:03PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUDOUN...SOUTHWESTERN FAIRFAX...EAST CENTRAL FAUQUIER...AND PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES...THE WEST CENTRAL CITY OF FAIRFAX...THE CITY OF MANASSAS PARK AND THE CITY OF MANASSAS... At 403 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Linton Hall, or 10 miles southwest of Centreville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Centreville, Dale City, Fairfax, Lake Ridge, Linton Hall, Oakton, Chantilly, Montclair, Bull Run, Haymarket, Manassas, Sudley, Manassas Park, Fairfax Station, Gainesville, New Baltimore, Independent Hill, Nokesville, Catlett and Clifton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Fairfax; Fauquier; Loudoun; Prince William
